job.title: Data Scientist
job.description:
Data Scientist

BETSOL is looking for a Data Scientist!

 

We’re looking for someone with experience manipulating data sets and building statistical models.

An ideal candidate should have excellent communication skills, solid programming and problem-solving skills, and a solid grasp of statistics and/or Machine Learning.

 

What You'll Do

As a Data Scientist you will support data-science and other analytics as needed. You will Develop SQL queries and data sets as well as develop business and client facing reports.


Responsibilities:

  • Understand business problems and suggest data and analytic solutions to support decision makers.
  • Help develop and transform data sets using variety of programming languages.
  • Develop and test analytic hypotheses using established methods.
  • Create data visualizations that convey a clear story about what is observed in the data.
  • Design, develop, and validate predictive and explanatory models using a wide variety of models.
  • Communicate results to variety of audiences.


Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree with evidence of quantitative aptitude.
  • 4-6 years of experience with agent-based, discrete event, or systems dynamics modeling methodologies; manipulating data sets and building statistical models, doing analysis, causal inference
  • 4-6 years of experience programming in R, Python, or another programming language.
  • 4-6 years of experience using analytical or statistical software technologies
  • Experience with data cleaning, manipulation, discovery, analysis, and visualization of data
  • Experience creating and using advanced machine learning algorithms and statistics: regression, simulation, scenario analysis, modeling, clustering, decision trees, neural networks, etc. 
  • Knowledge and experience in statistical and data mining techniques: GLM Regression, Random Forest, Boosting, Trees, text mining, social network analysis, etc.
  • Experience visualizing/presenting data for stakeholders


Preferred Experience

  • Master’s degree or Ph.D. in computer science, statistics, data science, mathematics, engineering or other quantitative field
  • Analytic or operational experience and / or education in Pharmacy, Nursing, Public Health, or other relevant medicine topics is appreciated.
  • Experience using statistical computer languages (R, Python, SQL, etc.)
  • Experience in Health care industry a plus; specifically working for a health-plan, data collection in Medicaid space.
